image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Famine in northern Gaza 'occurring or imminent', warn experts
item.description: The UN Security Council received dire warnings about a looming famine in northern Gaza due to Israel's month-long siege. While the US urged Israel against forcible displacement and starvation tactics, Israel refuted the famine claims, citing aid deliveries. However, the UN reported the lowest aid levels in the past month, raising concerns about a humanitarian catastrophe.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Southwest Airlines plane hit by bullet at Dallas airport
item.description: A Southwest Airlines flight bound for Indianapolis from Dallas Love Field experienced a shocking incident on Friday night. As the plane was preparing for takeoff, a bullet struck the aircraft near the flight deck. Thankfully, no injuries were reported among the passengers or crew. Law enforcement was immediately notified, and the plane was taken out of service for investigation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Gabon votes on new constitution hailed by junta as 'turning point'
item.description: Gabon is holding a referendum on a new constitution following the end of the Bongo dynasty after a coup. The proposed constitution limits presidential terms, eliminates the prime minister position, and prevents dynastic transfers of power. The vote is seen as a step towards civilian rule, with transitional President General Brice Oligui Nguema advocating for a 'yes' vote.

item.title: 'He may send me': Joe Biden jokes about going to space to rescue stranded ISS astronauts
item.description: During an APEC meeting, President Biden joked about his wife's threat to send him to space with Nasa Administrator Bill Nelson's help if he misbehaves. He linked his quip to the ongoing situation with stranded astronauts awaiting their return to Earth. Biden also acknowledged Peru's involvement in space exploration initiatives.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Prince Harry moves forward with lawsuit against Murdoch's NGN while most claimants settle
item.description: Prince Harry maintains his lawsuit against Rupert Murdoch's News Group Newspapers (NGN) over unlawful information gathering, despite other claimants settling. Harry alleges NGN targeted him for private information between 1996 and 2011. The trial is scheduled for January, where Harry's legal team will argue that senior figures at NGN were aware of and potentially involved in the unlawful activities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: $64,000 heist spree: Thieves target UPS and FedEx trucks in NYC, loot Gucci and Apple items
item.description: A string of robberies targeting UPS and FedEx delivery vehicles plagued New York City, spanning from April to November. A group of five masked thieves, sometimes working in smaller groups, made off with jewelry, electronics, designer goods, and other valuables exceeding $64,000 in total. Despite surveillance footage capturing the suspects, no arrests have been made.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Close call in Hawaii: American Airlines flight narrowly escapes collision with mountains
item.description: An American Airlines flight from Honolulu to Los Angeles had a close call with mountains in Hawaii. Air traffic control urgently instructed the pilots to climb quickly after they missed a required turn, potentially averting a collision with the Koʻolau range. While the airline claims no terrain clearance issues, the incident is under investigation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Karoline Leavitt? Youngest White House press secretary
item.description: Donald Trump has appointed Karoline Leavitt, his 2024 campaign spokesperson, as White House press secretary for his second term. The 27-year-old previously served as assistant press secretary in Trump's first administration. Leavitt also worked as communications director for Rep. Elise Stefanik and ran for a House seat in 2022.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: More Russians denounce each other over Ukraine, in echo of Soviet era
Nasa says Sunita Williams in 'incredible health' on ISS, denies 'losing weight' talk
Musk met Iran's UN ambassador to discuss ways to defuse tensions with US, say Tehran officials
Lara Trump could fill Rubio’s Senate seat

Putin talks with German chancellor Scholz, breaking ice with the West
Iran backs Lebanon in ceasefire talks, seeks end to 'problems'
Donald Trump names Karoline Leavitt as White House press secretary
item.description: US President-elect Donald Trump has appointed Karoline Leavitt as his White House press secretary. A staunch Trump defender, Leavitt previously served in his first administration and recently led communications for his 2024 campaign. At 29, she becomes the youngest-ever White House press secretary, surpassing Ron Ziegler's record set in 1969.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk reacts to major advertisers returning to X after boycott: 'We super appreciate...'
item.description: Elon Musk and CEO Linda Yaccarino are being lauded as major brands like IBM and Disney return to advertising on X after a nearly year-long hiatus. This follows reports of a significant drop in ad revenue attributed to concerns about brand safety under Musk's leadership.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump appoints former campaign official Steven Cheung as White House communications director
item.description: US President-elect Donald Trump has appointed Steven Cheung, his former campaign spokesman, as White House communications director. Sergio Gor will lead the Presidential Personnel Office. North Dakota Governor Doug Burgum, who briefly challenged Trump for the 2024 GOP nomination, will be heading the Department of the Interior.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: King Charles can't have 'unilateral' talks with Prince Harry if Prince William is 'not' in agreement: Royal author
item.description: Royal biographer Robert Hardman emphasizes that King Charles III must involve both Prince William and Prince Harry in any decisions regarding their fractured relationship. Hardman highlights the importance of a "three-way process" for reconciliation, emphasizing the significance of Prince William's agreement due to potential impacts on his inheritance and public perception.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Matt Gaetz's sexual misconduct report will remain secret? House Speaker says 'terrible precedent' if published
item.description: “I’m going to strongly request that the Ethics Committee not issue the report because that is not the way we do things in the House, and I think that would be a terrible precedent to set,” Speaker of the House Mike Johnson told reporters Friday. On Thursday, he was at Mar-a-Lago with Donald Trump and the nudge apparently came from there.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
